bibl.title: Dispatch from Augustus Archer Silva to William H. Seward
Despatches from United States consuls in St. Paul de Loanda, 1854-1893

revisionDesc.change: Creation of individual xml files, review, and addition encoding

div1.opener:
No. 46
United States Commercial Agency St. Paul de Loanda 21st August 1868
To Hon: Mr. H. Seward Secretary of State Washington
div1.p:
Sir
I have the honor to acknowledge the reception of all the despatches from the Department up to No. 24.

I was not able to take andvantage of my leave of absence last year, but I desire to this. I find however some difficulty in leaving the Commericial Agency in charge of an American, as Mr. Frederick A. Silva the Vice Commercial Agent has returned to the United States, and I am the only American remaining here.

The speciality of the case warrants me to suggest to the Department the propriety of leaving the office in charge of Mr. Robt. S. Newton, during my absence. This gentleman
gentleman is of Scotch birth and a member of my Counting-house, and to whom I shall entrust the management of my business during my absence.
The Department will confer a favor to reply as early as convenient.

closer.salute:
I have the honor
to be
Sir
Your most Obt. Sert.
